[[File:Pete Amachree - Melian the Maia and her daughter Lúthien, in the throne room of Menegroth.jpg|thumb|''Melian the Maia and her daughter Lúthien, in the throne room of Menegroth'' by [[:Category:Images_by_Pete_Amachree|Pete Amachree]]]]'''Menelrond''' was the name of the throne room of [[Thingol]] in [[Menegroth]]. It was so named because of its huge dome adorned with [[silver]] and precious stones, the arrangement of which, thanks to [[Melian]]'s visions, perfectly respected the position of the stars of the [[Dome of Varda|Dome of Valmar]].<ref>{{PM|Ros}}, p. 371</ref>

== Etymology ==
[[Christopher Tolkien]] translated the [[Sindarin]] name ''Menelrond'' as "heaven-dome".<ref>{{PM|Rosnotes}}, ''Note 20'', p. 376</ref>

It combines the elements ''[[menel]]'' ("heavens") + ''-[[rond]]'' ("dome").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-959717591.html|articlename=S. ''Menelrond'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=16 August 2023}}</ref>
